// Health/README.md
# Health System Setup Guide
## Folder Structure - `Core/` – Health logic - `Interfaces/` – All interfaces - `Shield/` – Shield logic - `Invincibility/` – Invincibility logic - `Damage/` – Damage logic and conditions
## How to Compose Entities in Unity Editor
### Player (Basic) - Add `HealthComponent` (Core)
### Player with Shield - Add `HealthComponent` (Core) - Add `ShieldComponent` (Shield)
### Player with Invincibility - Add `HealthComponent` (Core) - Add `InvincibilityComponent` (Invincibility) - Connect to your `IPowerUp` system to toggle invincibility
### Enemy - Add `HealthComponent` (Core)
### Hazard (Standard) - Add `HazardComponent` (Damage) - Add `DamageDealerComponent` (Damage) - Add a damage condition (e.g., `AlwaysAllowDamage`, `OnlyInvincibleCanDamage`, `OnlyShieldedCanDamage`) as needed - Assign the condition(s) to the `HazardComponent`'s `damageConditions` array in the Inspector
### Custom Damage Conditions - Create a new MonoBehaviour implementing `IDamageCondition` - Add it to the hazard GameObject - Assign it in the `HazardComponent`
## Extending - To add new damage conditions, create a new script implementing `IDamageCondition` and add it in the Editor. No need to modify existing code.
## Events - Use UnityEvents or C# events on components for custom reactions (e.g., OnDeath, OnShieldBroken)
## Cleanup - Remove old scripts like `ShieldActiveDisappearHazard`, `OnlyInvincibilityDamageController`, etc. after migration.
